lines.content: * Fork this repo to your GitHub account and clone the fork to your computer
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first).
1. Set up the correct JDK version.
* Click `Configure` > `Structure for new Projects` (in older versions of Intellij:`Configure` > `Project Defaults` > `Project Structure`).
* If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11.
1. Locate the project directory and click `OK`.
1. Select `Create project from existing sources` and click `Next`.
1. Rename the project if you want. Click `Next`.
1. Ensure that your src folder is checked. Keep clicking `Next`.

`Level-10` | JavaFX tutorials:
→ [Part 1: Introduction to JavaFX][fx1]
→ [Part 2: Creating a GUI for duke.Duke][fx2]
→ [Part 3: Interacting with the user][fx3]
→ [Part 4: Introduction to FXML][fx4]
* If you have feedback or bug reports, please post in [se-edu/duke issue tracker](https://github.com/se-edu/duke/issues).
Duke is a personal text-based chat-bot application used for managing tasks.
Duke is capable of handling 3 different types of tasks:
* _**Deadline**_ (Consists of a short description and task deadline details)
* _**Event**_ (Consists of a short description and task location details)
* Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed in your Computer.
* Download the latest version of duke.jar [here](https://github.com/dejunnn/duke/releases).
* Open and run the duke.jar file.
* Duke will store task list data as a "duke.txt" file in the "data" directory.
If there is no directory present, Duke will create one upon startup. Duke will also create an empty duke.txt file.
No existing file is found, new file created: duke.txt
If there is an existing directory and duke.txt file present, Duke will load existing data from the file.
File already exists. Existing data loaded from: duke.txt
The following text-based user interface should be displayed:
Hello! I'm Duke. What can I do for you?
Type /help for a list of supported commands.
This command creates a new task and adds it to the task list.
The respective tasks will be created and added to the task list.
Noted! I have added a new todo.
You now have 1 tasks in the list.
Noted! I have added a new deadline.
You now have 2 tasks in the list.
Noted! I have added a new event.
You now have 3 tasks in the list.
This command deletes a task from the task list depending on the specified index.
* Delete task at specified index: `delete index`
The task at the specified index will be deleted from the list.
Got it! The following task has been successfully deleted:
This command marks a task as done depending on the specified index.
* Mark task as done at specified index: `done index`
The task at the specified index will be marked as done.
Great! I have marked this task as done.
This command displays the current task list.
All tasks in the task list will be displayed according to their current index.
Here are the tasks in your list:
This command clears the current task list.
All tasks in the task list will be cleared after second confirmation by the user.
Are you sure you want to clear all tasks in your list? Type 'Y' to confirm.
Your task list has been cleared successfully!
Are you sure you want to clear all tasks in your list? Type 'Y' to confirm.
You task list has not been cleared.
This command performs a search of all tasks currently in the task list and displays
a list of all tasks that contains a specified substring in the description.
All matching tasks in the task list will be displayed in a numbered list.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
This command displays the list of commands supported by the application.
The list of all commands supported by the application will be displayed.
The following commands are supported by Duke:
To add a ToDo, enter: todo description
To add a Deadline, date in yyyy-mm-dd or otherwise, enter: deadline /by date
To add an Event, enter: event /at location
To find a task from a substring, enter: find substring
To delete a task from your task list with its index, enter: delete index
To mark a task as done with its index, enter: done index
To display your task list, enter: list
To clear your task list, enter: clear
To display the help list, enter: /help
To exit the programme, enter: bye
This command is used to exit the application.
Goodbye. Hope to see you again soon!

*

Duke is a personal text-based chat-bot application used for managing tasks.
* The application takes in relevant user input to manage and maintain a tasklist.

*

Duke is the public class responsible for creating the application and taking in the
* relevant user input required by the user.
* @version CS2113 AY19/20 Sem 2 Individual Project - Duke
* Creates the relevant objects required for the application to run.
* It takes in user input and executes the respective commands.

*

Exceptions caused by improper input and other errors are caught
* ByeCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* Executes the ByeCommand and exits the application.
* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* ClearCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* Executes the ClearCommand and clears the task list.
* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* Command is a public abstract class providing a skeletal implementation for
* different commands and is responsible for storing the base information
* required in a command, allowing other more specific events to draw onto its
* The command prompt entered by the user.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* Returns the command prompt entered by the user.
* @return the command prompt entered by the user.
* Abstract method to execute the Command.
* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage);
* DeadlineCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.

* The description of the deadline entered by the user.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* @param description the description of the deadline entered by the user.
* @param by the deadline/date entered by the user.
public DeadlineCommand(String command, String description, String by) {
* Executes the DeadlineCommand and creates a new deadline task in the tasklist.

* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {

* The index of the task to be deleted entered by the user.

* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* DoneCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* The index of the task to be marked as done entered by the user.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* @param index the index of the task to be marked as done entered by the user.
* Executes the DoneCommand and marks the task as done.
* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* EventCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.

* The description of the event entered by the user.

* @param description the description of the event entered by the user.
* @param at the location of the event entered by the user.
public EventCommand(String command, String description, String at) {

public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* FindCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* The substring used to find matching tasks entered by the user.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* @param substring the substring used to find matching tasks entered by the user.
* Executes the FindCommand and searches for tasks with descriptions matching the substring,
* displaying these tasks in an ordered list.

* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* HelpCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* Executes the HelpCommand and displays the help menu.
* @param tasklist the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* @param storage the object containing storage functions.
public void execute(TaskList tasklist, UI ui, Storage storage) {
* ListCommand inherits from command and is the public class responsible for storing information and executing the command.
* @param command the command prompt entered by the user.
* Executes the ListCommand and displays all the tasks in the tasklist in an ordered list.

* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.

* InvalidCommandException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid commands.
* InvalidDataException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid data.
* InvalidDeadlineException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid deadline tasks.
* InvalidEventException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid event tasks.
* InvalidFormatException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid input format.
* InvalidToDoException inherits from Exception and is the public class responsible for catching invalid to-do tasks.
* Parser is the public class responsible for parsing user input and generating the relevant commands.
* The command prompt entered by the user.
* The description of the command entered by the user.
* The number of relevant arguments in the command entered by the user.
* Parses the user input and prepares it to be analysed and used to generate commands.
* @throws InvalidCommandException if user input has too few arguments.
public static void prepareInput(String input) throws InvalidCommandException {
* Analyses the user input and generates the relevant command.
* @return  the command generated from the user input.
* @throws InvalidCommandException if command is not supported by application.
* @throws InvalidDeadlineException if format for creating new deadline is wrong.
* @throws InvalidEventException if format for creating new event is wrong.
* @throws InvalidToDoException if format for creating new to-do is wrong.
* @throws InvalidFormatException if format for command is wrong.
public static Command parseInput(String input) throws InvalidCommandException, InvalidDeadlineException, InvalidEventException, InvalidToDoException, InvalidFormatException {
* Storage is the public class responsible for creating and managing the data files generated from the application.
* The object containing the list containing all current tasks.
* The object containing user interface functions.
* The file path of the data file that contains tasklist information.
* The file path of the directory that contains the data file.
* Message to notify user that a new directory is created.
private static String CREATE_DIRECTORY_MESSAGE = "New Directory created: ";
* Message to notify user that there is no existing data file and that a new data file is created.
private static String CREATE_NEW_FILE_MESSAGE = "No existing file is found, new file created: ";
* Message to notify user that there is an existing data file and that it is loaded into the tasklist.
private static String LOAD_EXISTING_FILE_MESSAGE = "File already exists. Existing data loaded from: ";
* @param tasklist the object containing the list containing all current tasks.
* @param ui the object containing user interface functions.
* Firstly, searches for the data directory, if absent, creates a new directory.
* Secondly, searches for the data file in the directory, if absent, creates a new data file.
* If data file is present, loads the existing data from the file into the tasklist
* such that it is accessible by the user.
* Reads the data file and parses the existing data in the file, converting it into tasks which is added into
* the tasklist such that it is accessible by the user.
* Clears all content in the data file.
* Rewrites the data file to reflect the current data in the tasklist.
* Appends a new line of data into the data file.
* @param task The task to be written to the file.
BufferedWriter myWriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(FILE_PATH, true));
* Deadline inherits from Task and is the public class responsible for storing information about the task.
* The deadline/date entered by the user.
* @param description the description of the deadline entered by the user.
* @param by the deadline/date entered by the user.
* Returns the information related to the Deadline object.
* @return the information related to the Deadline object.
* Event inherits from Task and is the public class responsible for storing information about the task.
* The location of the event entered by the user.
* @param description the description of the event entered by the user.
* @param at the location of the event entered by the user.
* Returns the information related to the Event object.
* @return the information related to the Event object.
* Task is the public class responsible for storing information about the task.
* The type of task entered by the user.
* The description of the task entered by the user.
* The current done status of the task entered by the user.
* @param taskType the type of task entered by the user.
* @param description the description of the task entered by the user.
* Update the done status of the task.
* @param update the updated done status of the task.
* Returns the done status of the task.
* @return the done status of the task.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns the type of the task.
* Returns the done status icon of the task.
* @return the done status icon of the task.
* Returns the information related to the Task object.
* @return the information related to the Task object.
* TaskList is the public class responsible for maintaining the tasklist.
* Adds a new task to the tasklist.
* @param task the new task added to the tasklist.
* Removes an existing task from the tasklist.
* @param task the task removed from the tasklist.
* Returns the length of the tasklist.
* Clears all tasks from the tasklist.
* To-Do inherits from Task and is the public class responsible for storing information about the task.
* @param description the description of the to-do entered by the user.
* Returns the information related to the to-do object.
* @return the information related to the to-do object.
